column1: CURRICULUM: Timetable for classes - HTML, CSS and JavaScript

column3: Objectives
Understand what HTML is and what it is used for.
Learn the basic HTML tags and attributes
Create a simple HTML page.
Learn more about HTML tags and attributes
Practice using HTML tags and attributes to create different types of elements on a web page
Learn about the different types of HTML elements.
Practice using HTML elements to create a more complex web page.
Learn how to create HTML forms.
Practice using HTML forms to collect user input.
Learn how to create HTML tables.
Practice using HTML tables to display data in a structured way.
Objectives
Understand what CSS is and what it is used for.
Learn the basic CSS properties
Practice using CSS properties to style a web page.
Learn about the different types of CSS selectors
Practice using CSS selectors to target specific elements on a web page.
Learn more about CSS properties.
Practice using CSS properties to style a more complex web page.
Learn how to use CSS to control the layout of a web page.
Practice using CSS layout to create different types of layouts.
Learn how to use CSS to create animations.
Practice using CSS animations to add interactivity to a web page
Objectives
Understand what JavaScript is and what it is used for.
Learn the basic JavaScript syntax.
Create a simple JavaScript program
Learn about JavaScript variables and expressions
Practice using JavaScript variables and expressions to create more complex JavaScript programs
Learn how to create JavaScript functions.
Practice using JavaScript functions to make your JavaScript programs more reusable
Learn about JavaScript loops and conditional statements.
Practice using JavaScript loops and conditional statements to control the flow of your JavaScript programs.
Learn about JavaScript events.
Practice using JavaScript events to respond to user interaction.
Objectives
Learn about JavaScript objects.
Practice using JavaScript objects to store data and code.
Learn about JavaScript arrays.
Practice using JavaScript arrays to store and manipulate data.
Learn about the JavaScript DOM.
Practice using the JavaScript DOM to interact with the web page.
Learn about JavaScript AJAX
Practice using JavaScript AJAX to make asynchronous requests to the server.
Learn how to use JavaScript to create games.
Practice using JavaScript to create a simple game.
Objectives

column2: Review of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
column3: Review the key concepts of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Practice using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to create a more complex web page.
Work on a personal project that uses HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Presentation and correction of Project Implementation Process
Final Project Presentation ,submission and Grading
Repetition of the main core concepts covered
